intro: Paeonia mascula subsp. kesrouanensis, commonly known as the Kesrouan peony, is a rare and endemic subspecies native to Lebanon. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features palmate leaves with a distinctive reddish underside and produces thick, fleshy roots. It thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade, often growing in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
